metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1257 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
platform/graphics/filters/FEColorMatrix.cpp in the SVG implementation in Blink, as used in Google Chrome before 43.0.2357.65, does not properly handle an insufficient number of values in an feColorMatrix filter, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (container overflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted document.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1257` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-browser-l10n - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-chromedriver - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.7.8-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.7.8-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.7.8-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.7.8-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.7.8-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
